alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Greene; Eastern Rensselaer; Eastern Schenectady; Eastern Ulster; Northern Washington; Schoharie; Southern Saratoga; Southern Washington; Western Albany; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess; Western Greene; Western Rensselaer; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 29 at 10:32AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Dangerous Cold Conditions Through This Afternoon... Bitterly cold temperatures only in the single digits to low teens combined with northerly winds sustained 5 - 15mph and gusts increasing up to 20 - 30mph will result in dangerous wind chills through this afternoon ranging -5 to -20 degrees. Those who need to venture outdoors today to clear roads or walkways should dress appropriately with multiple layers and limit time outdoors as cold conditions could result in frostbite to exposed skin and/or hypothermia if precautions are not taken. Running or even a brisk walk in these conditions could result in frostbite on exposed skin. Strong winds today will also result in blowing and drifting snow and winds could recover roads and walkways even after they have already been cleared.
